titleStmt.title: William Anderson et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG8592

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: We the undersigned would respectfully Petition His Excellency the Govornor of the State of Kentucky to remit A fine of $50 -- assessed against John. P. Beal in the Henry Cirtcuit Court at the Sepr term 1862 of said Court for carrying Consealed weapons -- on the following grounds. We Know said J.. P. Beal to be a peacable and well ordered Citizen -- And that he has no means which he can well spare from the support of his wife and Chrilden to pay said fine. As an Evidence of his being a peacable man you will find by Examining your Execution Journal that he is a Justice of the Peace in Carroll County Elected to that office by the People in the Worthville District in said county --
